episodeTitle: The Judicial Island! Full View of Enies Lobby!
episodeTitleJapanese: 司法の島!エニエス・ロビーの全貌!
episodeTitleRomanized: Shihō no shima! Eniesu Robī no zenbō!
description: As the Puffing Tom approaches Enies Lobby, Blueno uses his Door-Door Fruit powers to separate Robin from her would-be rescuers. He reveals glimpses of Robin's traumatic past involving the Buster Call on Ohara. Meanwhile, Yokozuna the giant frog joins the Straw Hats' rescue mission as CP9 arrives at the Judicial Island with their prisoners.

events.title: First Glimpse of Robin's Past - Buster Call on Ohara
events.description: Blueno reveals to Sanji and Sogeking that Robin witnessed the devastating Buster Call on her homeland Ohara as a child. This is the first time in the anime that Robin's traumatic past involving the World Government's genocide is explicitly shown in flashback.
events.significance: This is the first definitive glimpse of Robin's long-unexplained past, setting up the emotional core of the Enies Lobby arc. It reveals why Robin believes she must sacrifice herself and establishes the horrific trauma that has shaped her entire life.

quotes.text: She witnessed the Buster Call that destroyed her homeland when she was just a child.
quotes.speaker: Blueno
quotes.context: Revealing Robin's traumatic past to Sanji and Sogeking

events.title: Blueno Demonstrates Doa Doa no Mi Powers
events.description: Blueno uses his Door-Door Fruit abilities to create doors in the air and through solid objects, using them tactically to separate Robin from Sanji and Sogeking and to create an improvised dimension for their conversation.
events.significance: First major demonstration of Blueno's Devil Fruit abilities in combat, showcasing the versatility and tactical advantage of the Doa Doa no Mi. This establishes CP9 agents as formidable opponents with unique powers.

events.title: Blueno Uses Rankyaku on Sanji
events.description: Blueno emerges from a door behind Sanji and unleashes Rankyaku (Storm Leg), a Rokushiki technique that sends a slicing air blade attack, launching Sanji backwards across the train car.
events.significance: First appearance of the Rokushiki technique Rankyaku being used by Blueno, demonstrating the superhuman martial arts abilities that all CP9 agents possess beyond their Devil Fruit powers.

events.title: Sanji Nearly Falls Off the Train
events.description: After being hit by Blueno's Rankyaku attack, Sanji slides dangerously close to the edge of the train car. Robin and Sogeking watch in horror as he nearly falls off the speeding Puffing Tom.
events.significance: Creates tension and demonstrates the deadly stakes of the battle aboard the Sea Train, showing that CP9 agents are willing to kill to complete their mission.

events.title: Blueno Uses Shigan on Sogeking
events.description: Blueno uses Shigan (Finger Gun), another Rokushiki technique, to stab Sogeking with his finger, creating a wound similar to being shot. He strikes Sogeking multiple times, bringing him to his knees.
events.significance: Demonstrates the lethal effectiveness of Rokushiki techniques and establishes CP9's combat superiority. Sogeking's brave but futile resistance highlights the danger the crew faces.

quotes.text: There is one last thing - a pirate isn't allowed to leave their crew without their captain's permission!
quotes.speaker: Sogeking
quotes.context: Sogeking's final words to Robin before being defeated by Blueno

events.title: Robin Protects Sanji and Sogeking
events.description: Robin uses her Hana Hana no Mi powers to restrain Blueno, preventing him from further attacking Sanji and Sogeking. She promises not to escape if he stops hurting her friends, sacrificing her freedom to protect them.
events.significance: Demonstrates Robin's willingness to sacrifice herself for her crewmates, even though she believes her very existence puts them in danger. This moment shows her deep care for the Straw Hats despite her decision to leave.

quotes.text: I promise that I won't escape. Please don't hurt them anymore.
quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin restraining Blueno and pleading for her friends' safety

events.title: Yokozuna Joins the Rescue Mission
events.description: The giant sumo frog Yokozuna jumps onto the front of the Rocketman train, initially knocking it off the rails. After Kokoro speaks with him and explains their mission to save Franky, Yokozuna decides to join the group.
events.significance: Yokozuna becomes an ally in the rescue mission, adding his strength to the assault on Enies Lobby. This shows that even Tom's old companions are invested in saving Franky.

events.title: Arrival at Enies Lobby
events.description: The Puffing Tom carrying CP9, Franky, and Robin arrives at Enies Lobby, the Judicial Island. The full scope of the World Government stronghold is revealed - a massive fortified island that stands in eternal daylight.
events.significance: This marks the transition from the Water 7 Arc to the Enies Lobby Arc. The arrival at this impregnable government fortress sets the stage for one of One Piece's most epic rescue missions and battles.

events.title: CP9 and Prisoners Disembark at Enies Lobby
events.description: CP9 agents Rob Lucci, Blueno, Kalifa, Kaku, and others disembark from the Puffing Tom with their prisoners Franky and Robin, officially bringing them into the World Government's custody at the Judicial Island.
events.significance: Finalizes Robin and Franky's capture and marks the end of the Water 7 Arc. The heroes must now assault a World Government stronghold to save their friends.

quotes.text: There is one last thing - a pirate isn't allowed to leave their crew without their captain's permission!
quotes.speaker: Sogeking
quotes.context: Defending Robin's membership in the crew

quotes.text: I promise that I won't escape. Please don't hurt them anymore.
quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Protecting Sanji and Sogeking from Blueno

quotes.text: She witnessed the Buster Call that destroyed her homeland when she was just a child.
quotes.speaker: Blueno

themes.description: Robin's willingness to sacrifice her freedom to protect Sanji and Sogeking demonstrates her deep care for the Straw Hats, even as she tries to leave them. Sogeking's brave defiance of Blueno also shows the crew's commitment to Robin.
themes.symbolism: Robin restraining Blueno symbolizes her conflicted nature - using her power to protect others while simultaneously surrendering herself.

themes.description: The first glimpse of Robin's past reveals the deep psychological trauma that drives her actions. The Buster Call flashback introduces the horrific event that has haunted Robin since childhood.
themes.symbolism: The Buster Call represents the overwhelming power of the World Government and the trauma that shapes Robin's belief that she brings destruction to those around her.

themes.description: Sogeking's declaration that Robin can't leave without the captain's permission emphasizes the sacred bond of pirate crews in One Piece. Even facing death, he stands firm on this principle.
themes.symbolism: The Jolly Roger represents the unbreakable bonds of piracy that transcend individual choice.

characterSpotlights.development: Robin's traumatic past is revealed for the first time, explaining her resignation and willingness to sacrifice herself. She shows she still cares for the Straw Hats by protecting Sanji and Sogeking, even while accepting her fate.
keyActions: Has flashback to Buster Call on Ohara as a child
Allows Blueno to take her through his door dimension
Uses Hana Hana powers to restrain Blueno
Promises not to escape if Blueno spares her friends
Arrives at Enies Lobby as a prisoner
quotes: I promise that I won't escape. Please don't hurt them anymore.

characterSpotlights.development: As Sogeking, Usopp shows tremendous courage in standing up to Blueno despite being vastly outmatched. He articulates the pirate code that Robin belongs to the crew.
keyActions: Is stabbed multiple times by Shigan but continues fighting
Declares that Robin can't leave without Luffy's permission
Witnesses Robin's sacrifice to protect him and Sanji
quotes: There is one last thing - a pirate isn't allowed to leave their crew without their captain's permission!

characterSpotlights.development: Blueno demonstrates the full extent of his Door-Door Fruit powers and Rokushiki techniques, establishing himself as a deadly opponent. He also serves as the expositor for Robin's past.
keyActions: Uses Doa Doa no Mi to separate Robin from rescuers
Reveals Robin's past involving the Buster Call
Uses Shigan multiple times on Sogeking
Is restrained by Robin to protect the Straw Hats
quotes: She witnessed the Buster Call that destroyed her homeland when she was just a child.

characterSpotlights.role: New ally joining the rescue mission
characterSpotlights.development: Yokozuna the giant frog transitions from obstacle to ally, joining the Rocketman crew to help save Franky from Enies Lobby.
keyActions: Jumps onto the Rocketman, knocking it off rails
Communicates with Kokoro about the mission
Decides to join the rescue mission to Enies Lobby

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded some of the sequences on the Puffing Tom and added additional reaction shots of characters witnessing events.

trivia.fact: This is the final episode of the Water 7 Arc, which began with episode 229. The arc spanned 35 episodes.

This is the last episode featuring Kazue Ikura as the voice of Tony Tony Chopper. She temporarily replaced Ikue Ōtani during episodes 254-263 while Ōtani was on maternity leave. Ōtani returned to the role starting with episode 264.

Both the opening song 'Kokoro no Chizu' by BOYSTYLE and the ending song 'Asu wa Kuru Kara' by Tohoshinki are used for the final time in this episode, marking the end of an era before the Enies Lobby Arc begins.

sources.title: Kokoro no Chizu - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: This is the first episode in the anime to show a definitive glimpse of Robin's past involving the Buster Call on Ohara, though her full backstory is explored in detail in later episodes (275-277).
Enies Lobby is known as the 'never-night island' because it apparently always stands in full daylight. The island also features a mysterious massive waterfall leading to a black void beneath it.
Episode 263 adapts parts of manga chapters 374 and 375, covering the transition from Water 7 to Enies Lobby.
